summary: Medical wound assessment application that analyzes wound images to track healing progress through multiple metrics including area, perimeter, shape regularity, color composition, texture, edge sharpness, and moisture appearance
architectural_notes: Image processing pipeline required for wound analysis
Computer vision algorithms needed for area, perimeter, and shape calculations
Color segmentation for tissue type classification (red/pink/yellow/black)
Texture analysis for surface smoothness detection
Edge detection algorithms for boundary sharpness
Clinical interpretation mapping for healing assessment
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Medical wound reference illustration showing healthy granulation tissue in red tones (wound-reference.dim_400x300.png)
- Icon set for seven wound metrics with medical styling: area, perimeter, shape, color, texture, edge, moisture (metric-icons.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create image upload interface that accepts wound photographs and displays the uploaded image for analysis

Implement wound area measurement that calculates total wound size in pixels and displays the result with interpretation (decreasing area indicates good healing, increasing area indicates delayed healing or infection)
Calculate wound perimeter and analyze smoothness, displaying results with clinical interpretation (smooth, smaller perimeter indicates healing; large or irregular perimeter indicates inflammation)
Analyze wound shape regularity and circularity, displaying metrics with interpretation (high circularity indicates better contraction; irregular shape indicates tissue damage or slow healing)

Perform color composition analysis of wound tissue, calculating percentages of red, pink, yellow, and black colors with clinical meanings: red = healthy granulation tissue (good healing), pink = epithelialization (new skin formation), yellow = slough/dead tissue (slow healing), black = necrosis (severe damage). Display results with interpretation that increase in red/pink indicates improvement and increase in yellow/black indicates concern.
Analyze wound texture smoothness and display results with interpretation (smooth texture indicates tissue recovery)
Detect wound edge sharpness and boundary definition, displaying results with interpretation (sharp edges indicate stabilized healing; fuzzy edges indicate active inflammation)
Detect exudate and moisture appearance by identifying shiny or fluid regions in the wound image, displaying results with interpretation (too wet or glossy indicates risk of poor healing)
Create a comprehensive results dashboard that displays all seven wound metrics together with visual indicators, clinical interpretations, and overall healing status summary
Implement wound tracking history that allows users to upload multiple wound images over time and compare measurements to track healing progress

Apply a clean, professional medical interface design with a calming green and white color scheme, clear typography optimized for readability of clinical data, and organized layout that prioritizes critical metrics like color composition
